meanings.definition: Capable of being acquired or obtained.
meanings.sent1: The new video game was gainable with just a few hours of saving up.
meanings.sent2: The knowledge from the library was easily gainable through reading.
meanings.sent3: The gainable prize at the fair made everyone excited to play the games.
meanings.sent4: Her trust was a gainable treasure that he worked hard to earn.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is to focus on gainable skills that can be learned over time.

meanings.definition: Able to be achieved or reached.
meanings.sent1: With determination, the top of the mountain was gainable for the hiker.
meanings.sent2: The dream of becoming a doctor seemed more gainable after passing the entrance exam.
meanings.sent3: The gainable target of running a marathon motivated her to train every day.
meanings.sent4: His goal of starting his own business became more gainable as he saved money.
meanings.sent5: The prize for the competition was a gainable reward for all the hard work put in.
